o: To virtually modify history without changing commit hashes

q: What is the purpose of git grafts (legacy feature)?
o: Artificially connecting commits that are not actually related

q: What replaced git grafts for history modification?
What is the purpose of git filter-branch for merge history?
o: Rewrites branches by applying filters to each commit

q: What has replaced git filter-branch for modern history rewriting?
What is the purpose of git gc after many merges?
o: Garbage collection to optimize repository size and performance

q: When should you run git gc after rebasing?
o: After the reflog entries expire to reclaim space from old commits

q: What is the purpose of git prune?
o: Removes unreachable objects from the object database

q: Why are unreachable objects created during rebase?
o: Original commits become unreachable when new ones are created

q: What is the purpose of git fsck in merge integrity?
o: Verifies the integrity and connectivity of objects in the repository

q: When might you run git fsck after a problematic merge?
o: To check for corruption or missing objects

q: What is the purpose of git count-objects?
o: Shows the number of unpacked objects and disk space used

q: How do you monitor repository size after many merges?
o: git count-objects -vH for verbose human-readable output

q: What is the purpose of git rev-parse in merge scripts?
o: Translates various revision specifications to commit hashes

q: How do you get the current branch name for merge scripts?
What is the purpose of git symbolic-ref in merge workflows?
o: Reads or modifies which branch HEAD points to

q: How do you check if HEAD is detached before merging?
o: git symbolic-ref HEAD returns error if detached

q: What is the purpose of git var in merge automation?
o: Shows Git logical variables like editor, pager, author identity

q: How do you get the configured merge tool programmatically?
o: git config merge.tool or check git var GIT_EDITOR for editor

q: What is the purpose of git config --get-regexp for merge configuration?
o: Lists all configuration values matching a pattern

q: How do you list all merge-related configurations?
What is the purpose of git for-each-ref in branch management?
o: Iterates over refs with customizable format output

q: How do you list branches sorted by last commit date for merge prioritization?
What is the purpose of git name-rev?
o: Gives a commit a symbolic name relative to a ref

q: How can git name-rev help understand merge history?
o: Shows which branch or tag a commit is relative to

q: What is the purpose of git show-branch?
o: Shows branches and their commits in a visual format

q: How can git show-branch help with merge planning?
o: Visualizes how branches diverge and what commits differ

q: What is the purpose of core.excludesFile for merge-related ignores?
o: Specifies a global gitignore file for patterns to ignore

q: What files might you want to exclude from merge consideration?
o: Generated files, build artifacts, editor backups

q: What is the purpose of sparse checkout in merge workflows?
o: Checks out only selected directories for faster operations on large repos

q: How can sparse checkout help with merging large repositories?
o: Reduces working directory size, speeding up operations

q: What is the purpose of git maintenance in repository health?
What maintenance tasks help after many merge/rebases?
What is the purpose of commit-graph in Git performance?
o: Caches commit graph data for faster history traversal

q: How does commit-graph improve merge-base calculations?
o: Pre-computed generation numbers speed up ancestor queries

q: What is the purpose of multi-pack-index in large repositories?
o: Indexes multiple packfiles for faster object access

q: What is the purpose of partial clone for merge efficiency?
o: Clones repository without all objects, fetching on demand

q: How can partial clone help with merge operations on large repos?
o: Reduces initial clone time; objects fetch only when needed for merge

q: What is the purpose of git credential helpers for remote merges?
o: Caches or stores authentication for remote repository access

q: What is the purpose of git config credential.helper for merge pushes?
o: Configures how to store credentials for pushing merged changes

q: What is the purpose of git remote prune origin?
o: Removes remote-tracking branches that no longer exist on remote

q: Why prune after merging and deleting remote branches?
o: Removes stale references to merged and deleted branches

q: What is the purpose of git push --force-with-lease?
o: Force pushes only if remote matches expected state

q: When should you use --force-with-lease after rebase?
o: When pushing rebased commits to ensure you do not overwrite others work

q: What is the purpose of git push --force-if-includes?
o: Additional safety check that your local branch includes remote commits

q: What is the purpose of the pre-merge-commit hook?
o: Runs before the merge commit is created, can prevent commit

q: When is the pre-merge-commit hook triggered?
o: After successful merge but before creating the commit

q: What can the pre-merge-commit hook be used for?
o: Running tests or linting on merged content before committing

q: What is the purpose of the reference-transaction hook?
o: Runs before reference updates, can abort or audit ref changes

q: How can reference-transaction be used with merges?
o: To audit or validate branch updates resulting from merges

q: What is the purpose of git update-ref for merge automation?
o: Safely updates references with atomic operations

q: How do you atomically update multiple refs after a complex merge?
o: Use git update-ref --stdin with update commands

q: What is the purpose of git symbolic-ref for branch aliases?
o: Creates symbolic references like HEAD pointing to a branch

q: What is the purpose of GIT_DIR environment variable in merge scripts?
o: Specifies the location of the .git directory

q: What is the purpose of GIT_WORK_TREE in merge operations?
o: Specifies the working tree location separate from .git

q: What is the purpose of GIT_INDEX_FILE during merge?
o: Specifies an alternative index file location

q: How can you use alternative index files for merge testing?
o: Set GIT_INDEX_FILE to test merges without affecting main index

q: What is the purpose of git read-tree for merge operations?
o: Reads tree information into the index, used for low-level merging

q: How is git read-tree used for three-way merge?
What is the purpose of git write-tree?
o: Creates a tree object from the current index

q: When is git write-tree used in merge creation?
o: To create the tree object for the merge commit

q: What is the purpose of git commit-tree for merge commits?
o: Creates a commit object from a tree with specified parents

q: How do you create a merge commit with multiple parents using commit-tree?
o: git commit-tree tree -p parent1 -p parent2 -m message

q: What is the purpose of git mktree?
o: Creates a tree object from ls-tree formatted input

q: What is the purpose of git hash-object in merge reconstruction?
o: Computes the object hash and optionally stores the object

q: What is the purpose of git cat-file for merge analysis?
o: Displays content, type, or size of repository objects

q: How do you examine a merge commit object?
What is the purpose of git verify-commit for merge validation?
o: Verifies the GPG signature of a commit

q: How do you verify all merge commits are signed?
What is the purpose of git verify-pack?
o: Validates a packed archive file for integrity

q: What is the purpose of git index-pack?
o: Builds pack index file from a packed archive

q: What is the purpose of git unpack-objects?
o: Unpacks objects from a packed archive

q: What is the purpose of git pack-objects?
o: Creates packed archives of Git objects

o.q: What is the purpose of git show-ref for merge automation?
o: Lists references in a local repository

o.q: How can you list all branches including their commit hashes for merge scripts?
What is the purpose of git check-ref-format?
o: Validates that a reference name is well-formed

o.q: Why validate ref names before creating merge branches?
o: To prevent invalid characters that could cause problems

o.q: What is the purpose of git diff-tree for merge analysis?
o: Compares the content of two tree objects or a commit with its parent

o.q: How do you see what a merge commit changed?
o: git diff-tree -c commit-hash or git show commit-hash

o.q: What is the purpose of git diff-files?
o: Compares files in the working tree and the index

o.q: When might git diff-files be useful during merge conflicts?
o: To see what local modifications exist before resolving

o.q: What is the purpose of git diff-index?
o: Compares a tree with the index or working tree

o.q: How is git diff-index useful for pre-merge checks?
o: To verify the working tree is clean before merging

o.q: What is the purpose of git ls-tree for merge operations?
o: Lists the contents of a tree object

o.q: How can git ls-tree help analyze merge commit content?
o: Shows the file structure at any commit for comparison

o.q: What is the purpose of git check-attr for merge drivers?
How do you verify which merge driver applies to a file?
What is the purpose of git checkout-index for merge operations?
o: Copies files from index to working tree

o.q: How can checkout-index be used in merge scripts?
o: To extract specific versions of files during conflict resolution

o.q: What is the purpose of git merge-one-file?
o: A helper script for merging individual files (used by merge drivers)

o.q: What is the purpose of git fmt-merge-msg?
o: Generates a default merge commit message

o.q: How is git fmt-merge-msg used in merge automation?
o: To generate consistent merge messages programmatically

o.q: What is the purpose of the merge.defaultToUpstream configuration?
o: Allows git merge with no arguments to merge from upstream

o.q: What is the purpose of merge.renameLimit?
o: Sets the maximum number of file pairs to consider for rename detection

o.q: When should you increase merge.renameLimit?
o: When many files are renamed and detection is incomplete

o.q: What is the purpose of merge.renames configuration?
o: Enables or disables rename detection during merge

o.q: What is the purpose of merge.directoryRenames?
o: Controls how directory renames are handled during merge

o.q: What are the values for merge.directoryRenames?
What is the purpose of merge.verbosity?
o: Controls how much information is displayed during merge

o.q: What is the purpose of merge.summary?
o: Whether to include commit summaries in merge commit messages

o.q: What is the purpose of merge.tool configuration?
o: Sets the default merge tool for conflict resolution

o.q: What is the purpose of mergetool.prompt?
o: Controls whether to prompt before launching each merge tool

o.q: What is the purpose of mergetool.keepBackup?
o: Controls whether to keep .orig files after merge resolution

o.q: What is the purpose of mergetool.keepTemporaries?
o: Controls whether to keep temporary files created during merge

o.q: What is the purpose of diff.renameLimit?
o: Sets rename detection limit for diff, which affects merge

o.q: What is the purpose of diff.algorithm configuration?
o: Sets the default diff algorithm which affects merge

o.q: What is the purpose of rebase.autoSquash?
o: Enables automatic squash/fixup commit reordering in interactive rebase

o.q: What is the purpose of rebase.autoStash?
o: Automatically stashes before rebase and applies after

o.q: What is the purpose of rebase.stat?
o: Shows a diffstat of upstream changes after rebase

o.q: What is the purpose of rebase.instructionFormat?
o: Customizes the commit format displayed in interactive rebase

o.q: What is the purpose of rebase.rescheduleFailedExec?
o: Automatically reschedules failed exec commands when continuing

o.q: What is the purpose of rebase.abbreviateCommands?
o: Uses short command forms in interactive rebase editor

o.q: What is the purpose of rebase.missingCommitsCheck?
o: Controls behavior when commits are removed from rebase todo

o.q: What are the values for rebase.missingCommitsCheck?
What is the purpose of pull.rebase configuration?
o: Controls whether git pull uses rebase instead of merge

o.q: What does pull.rebase=merges do?
o: Rebases with --rebase-merges to preserve merge commits

o.q: What is the purpose of branch.autoSetupMerge?
o: Controls automatic tracking branch setup when branching

o.q: What is the purpose of branch.autoSetupRebase?
o: Controls whether new branches automatically rebase on pull

o.q: What are the values for branch.autoSetupRebase?
What is the purpose of core.sparseCheckout for merge operations?
o: Enables sparse checkout mode for partial working tree

o.q: What is the purpose of core.worktree in merge scripts?
o: Sets the path to the working tree separate from .git

o.q: What is the purpose of core.bare for merge operations?
o: Indicates a repository without working tree; affects merge behavior

o.q: Can you merge in a bare repository?
What is the purpose of receive.denyNonFastForwards?
o: Prevents pushing non-fast-forward changes to a remote

o.q: How does receive.denyNonFastForwards affect merge workflows?
o: Forces linear history on shared branches

o.q: What is the purpose of receive.denyDeletes?
What is the purpose of transfer.fsckObjects?
o: Validates objects during fetch/push to detect corruption

o.q: What is the purpose of gc.auto for merge-heavy repositories?
o: Triggers automatic garbage collection based on object count

o.q: What is the purpose of gc.reflogExpire?
o: Sets how long reflog entries are kept before expiration

o.q: Why is reflog important for recovering from rebase mistakes?
o: It records HEAD positions allowing you to recover old states

o.q: What is the purpose of gc.pruneExpire?
o: Sets the grace period before unreachable objects are pruned

o.q: What is the purpose of pack.window for merge performance?
o: Sets the window size for delta compression in packs

o.q: What is the purpose of pack.depth for repository optimization?
o: Sets the maximum delta chain length in packs

o.q: What is the purpose of fetch.prune?
o: Automatically prunes stale remote-tracking branches on fetch

o.q: Why prune during fetch before merge?
o: To have accurate remote branch information for merge decisions

o.q: What is the purpose of push.default configuration?
o: Sets the default behavior for git push

o.q: What push.default value is safest after rebasing?
o: simple or current to avoid accidental overwrites

o.q: What is the purpose of status.showStash?
o: Shows stash count in git status output

o.q: Why is knowing about stashes important before merge?
o: Stashed changes might conflict with merge or need to be applied

o.q: What is the purpose of advice.statusHints?
o: Controls whether hints are shown in git status

o.q: What is the purpose of advice.resolveConflict?
o: Controls whether conflict resolution hints are shown

o.q: What is the purpose of log.date for merge history?
o: Sets the default date format for git log

o.q: What is the purpose of log.decorate for merge visualization?
o: Shows branch and tag names next to commits

o.q: What is the purpose of color.diff for merge conflict viewing?
o: Colors diff output for better readability

o.q: What is the purpose of color.branch for merge branch management?
What is the purpose of format.pretty for merge log output?
o: Sets the default format for git log

o.q: What is the purpose of alias.* for merge automation?
What is a useful merge-related alias example?
What is the purpose of sequence.editor for rebase?
o: Sets the editor for interactive rebase todo list

o.q: What is the purpose of core.editor for merge commits?
o: Sets the editor for commit messages including merge messages

o.q: What is the purpose of GIT_CHERRY_PICK_HELP for conflict messages?
o: An internal variable for displaying cherry-pick conflict help

o.q: What is the purpose of multiple remotes for merge workflows?
o: Allows fetching from multiple sources for comparison or merging

o.q: How do you fetch from multiple remotes before choosing what to merge?
What is the purpose of push.followTags?
o: Automatically pushes annotated tags with commits

o.q: What is the purpose of notes.rewrite for merge operations?
o: Configures which rewrite operations copy notes to new commits

o.q: What is the purpose of notes.rewriteRef?
o: Specifies the notes ref to copy during rewrites like rebase

o.q: What is an evil merge?
o: A merge where additional changes are made beyond conflict resolution

o.q: Why are evil merges problematic for git bisect?
o: The bug might be in the merge itself, not in either parent

o.q: What is the purpose of git show --cc for merge commits?
o: Shows combined diff for merge commits

o.q: What is a combined diff?
o: A diff showing changes relative to all parents of a merge

o.q: What is the purpose of git diff -m for merge commits?
o: Shows diff against each parent separately

o.q: What is the purpose of git log -p --cc for merge history?
o: Shows patch with combined diff for merge commits

o.q: What is the purpose of git log --boundary?
o: Shows boundary commits in revision ranges

o.q: What is a boundary commit in merge analysis?
o: A commit that defines the edge of a revision range

o.q: What is the purpose of git log --full-history for merge tracking?
o: Shows complete history including all merge paths

o.q: What is history simplification in git log?
o: Git omits commits that do not affect the final content

o.q: What is the purpose of git log --simplify-merges?
o: Removes merges that do not contribute to final content

o.q: What is the purpose of git log --date-order?
o: Shows commits in commit date order rather than topological

o.q: What is the purpose of git log --topo-order?
o: Shows commits in topological order (parents before children)

o.q: What is the purpose of git log --reverse for merge review?
o: Shows commits from oldest to newest

o.q: What is the purpose of git log --walk-reflogs?
o: Walks through reflog entries instead of commit ancestry

o.q: What is the purpose of git log -L for merge analysis?
o: Tracks changes to a line range across history

o.q: What is the purpose of git log --follow for renamed files in merges?
o: Follows renames to trace file history across renames

o.q: What is the purpose of git branch --contains for merge tracking?
o: Lists branches that contain a specific commit

o.q: What is the purpose of git tag --contains for merged releases?
o: Lists tags that contain a specific commit

o.q: What is the purpose of git branch --points-at?
o: Lists branches that point to a specific commit

o.q: What is the purpose of git rev-list --count for merge size?
o: Counts the number of commits in a revision range

o.q: How do you count commits that will be merged?
What is the purpose of git rev-list --left-right?
o: Shows which side (left or right) each commit comes from

o.q: How can --left-right help understand merge scope?
o: Shows commits unique to each branch before merging

o.q: What is the purpose of git diff --stat for merge preview?
o: Shows a summary of changes with file counts and +/- lines

o.q: How do you preview merge changes before merging?
o: git diff HEAD...branch or git diff $(git merge-base HEAD branch)..branch

o.q: What is the three-dot notation in git diff?
o: Compares from the merge-base to the second branch

o.q: What is the two-dot notation in git diff?
o: Direct comparison between two commits or branches
